title: Pet

properties.name: description
properties.value: A pet is a non-combat NPC loyal to a player that is generally obtained from monster drops and skilling. Most pets can be interacted with. Most pets do not serve a purpose other than aesthetics, as most pets are very rare drops from certain bosses or skilling activities, and thus are often considered prestigious. A player may only have one pet following them at one time. Pets only move at a walking pace (except for Nexling), if they become stuck and/or too far away from the player they follow, they'll teleport close to the player and continue. They can also be called to the player's side using the Call follower button under the Worn Equipment tab.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Pet
A menagerie housing many pets.

A pet is a non-combat NPC loyal to a player that is generally obtained from monster drops and skilling. Most pets can be interacted with. Most pets do not serve a purpose other than aesthetics, as most pets are very rare drops from certain bosses or skilling activities, and thus are often considered prestigious. A player may only have one pet following them at one time. Pets only move at a walking pace (except for Nexling), if they become stuck and/or too far away from the player they follow, they'll teleport close to the player and continue. They can also be called to the player's side using the Call follower button under the Worn Equipment tab.

Pets may be stored in the bank or inventory, and will follow the player when dropped. Players can store up to 52 pets in the Menagerie of a player-owned house (with the highest-level pet houses).

Unlike other pets, cats are the only kind of pets that must be raised to maturity by following the player. Kittens must be stroked and fed regularly or they will run away. Once they reach adult stage, they no longer need to be fed.

Contents

  • 1 Obtaining a pet
  • 2 List of pets
    • 2.1 Boss pets
    • 2.2 Skilling pets
    • 2.3 Other
  • 3 One-off pet totals
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 References

Obtaining a pet[edit | edit source]

When a player receives a one-off pet (i.e. a boss or skilling pet), it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a message in the chatbox will state You have a funny feeling like you're being followed. Upon receiving a pet, a small sound will be heard.

Receiving a pet
The sound which can be heard when players receive a one-off pet.

However, if a player receives a pet while having a follower out (for example, a cat), it will be placed into their inventory. When this occurs, the message in the chatbox will instead state You feel something weird sneaking into your backpack. If a players inventory is full and they have a follower already, they will not receive the pet. When skilling, the pet is prioritised over the resource gathered; it will be placed in the last inventory slot available,[1] while the resource gathered will be dropped underneath the player if their inventory becomes full. However, this does not apply to Farming due to the complexity of the skill's code.[2]

Players can still roll for pet drops even if they already own it. It does not affect their main drop, as pet drops are tertiary drops. When this happens, players will receive the message You have a funny feeling like you would have been followed... The only exception to this is the abyssal orphan due to being obtained differently compared to other pets.

If a player dies with a one-off pet following them (or if it is in their inventory and it is not one of the items protected on death) in a dangerous situation, the pet will be dropped and wander around the area for 30 seconds before despawning. Even if the player returns in time, the pet cannot be picked up. If the pet is not insured, players must re-obtain the pet as if they never had it. If insured, players can head to Probita and reclaim the pet for 1,000,000 coins. In order to insure a pet, the player must visit Probita and pay 500,000 coins. The player can still obtain the pet again from its respective drop source, and if the pet is re-obtained this way it will also be insured.

If a player runs out of membership with a pet still following them, the pet is placed in their inventory. They will receive the message Your pet is scared into your backpack.

List of pets[edit | edit source]

Boss pets[edit | edit source]

These pets usually resemble the bosses that drop them, or the bosses that they are associated with.

Pet Source Drop rate
Abyssal orphan Using an unsired on the Font of Consumption 1/2,560 (per Abyssal Sire kill)
5/128 (per unsired)

1/75 (per kill on Slayer task)

1/100 (per kill on Slayer task)

  1. ↑ To change into a baby mole-rat, a mole claw must be used on the baby mole.
  2. ↑ Sanguine dust is required to metamorphose into all five variants.
  3. ↑ To change into Little Parasite, a parasitic egg must be used on Little Nightmare.
  4. ↑ Metamorphic dust is required to metamorphose into all seven variants.
  5. ↑ An orange or blue egg sac is required to metamorphose into its respective variant.
  6. ↑ To change into JalRek-Jad, all six of TzHaar-Ket-Rak's Challenges must be completed.

Skilling pets[edit | edit source]

These pets are obtained by training a specific skill, with the chance of obtaining one being based on the player's level in the corresponding skill and the base chance of the activity being performed.

For all drop rates, use the formula: DropRate = 1 BaseChance − ( SkillLevel ∗ 25 ) {\displaystyle {\text{DropRate}}={\frac {1}{{\text{BaseChance}}-({\text{SkillLevel}}*25)}}} . Base chances are found in the individual page of each pet. Players with 200 million experience in the corresponding skill will be fifteen times more likely in receiving the skilling pet.[3]

As the rates use the player's base level, temporary skill boosts such as the dragon pickaxe's special attack or invisible boosts in areas such as the Woodcutting Guild do not affect the rate at which players can obtain these pets.[4]

Pet Source Drop rate



Baby chinchompa Obtained while hunting chinchompas See here

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
6 October 2016
(update)

Talking to various NPCs in Tale of Two Cats/Icthlarin’s Little Helper quests while other pets are visible displays the correct dialogue.

28 April 2016
(update | poll)
  • Call pet button has been added to force your follower to appear next to you.
  • You will now receive a message if you would have obtained the pet on that kill, only if you already own the boss pet.
30 April 2015
(update)

Pets now follow you up and down the Motherlode Mine's ladder.

9 April 2015
(update | poll)

The 'talk to' option is now the left-click option for boss pets rather than 'pick up'. Dialogue added for the chaos elemental pet, dark core pet and chompy bird pet.

21 August 2014
(update | poll)

Pet insurance is added to the game.

15 May 2014
(update)

The options on other players' pets are no longer visible.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When a pet is in the inventory as an item, its name may be incorrectly capitalised; this is because all items in Old School RuneScape use ucfirst capitalisation, wherein the first letter of a string is capitalised, but the rest is not. For example, as an inventory item, TzTok-Jad's pet is called Tzrek-jad, but as a follower it's called TzRek-Jad.
  • Players cannot go underwater if they have a pet following them or in their inventory, with the exception of pet kraken and pet chaos elemental. Furthermore, Tangleroot and Phoenix can be obtained underwater, but they cannot be taken back once the player leaves.

References[edit | edit source]

{{External|rs}} [[File:Pets in a menagerie.png|thumb|300px|A [[menagerie]] housing many pets.]] A '''pet''' is a non-combat [[Non-player character|NPC]] loyal to a [[Account|player]] that is generally obtained from [[Monsters|monster]] [[drops]] and skilling. Most pets can be interacted with. Most pets do not serve a purpose other than aesthetics, as most pets are very rare drops from certain [[boss]]es or skilling activities, and thus are often considered prestigious. A player may only have one pet following them at one time. Pets only move at a walking pace (except for [[Nexling]]), if they become stuck and/or too far away from the player they follow, they'll teleport close to the player and continue. They can also be called to the player's side using the [[Call follower]] button under the [[Worn Equipment]] tab. Pets may be stored in the [[bank]] or [[inventory]], and will follow the player when dropped. Players can store up to 52 pets in the [[Menagerie]] of a [[player-owned house]] (with the highest-level pet houses). Unlike other pets, [[cat]]s are the only kind of pets that must be raised to maturity by following the player. Kittens must be stroked and fed regularly or they will run away. Once they reach adult stage, they no longer need to be fed. ==Obtaining a pet== When a player receives a one-off pet (i.e. a [[boss]] or [[Skills|skilling]] pet), it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a message in the [[Chat Interface|chatbox]] will state {{RSFont|You have a funny feeling like you're being followed.|color=red}} Upon receiving a pet, a small sound will be heard. {{Listen |title = Receiving a pet |align = right |filename = Getting pet.ogg |desc = The sound which can be heard when players receive a one-off pet.}} However, if a player receives a pet while having a follower out (for example, a [[cat]]), it will be placed into their [[inventory]]. When this occurs, the message in the chatbox will instead state {{RSFont|You feel something weird sneaking into your backpack.|color=red}} If a players inventory is full '''and''' they have a follower already, they '''will not''' receive the pet. When skilling, the pet is prioritised over the resource gathered; it will be placed in the last inventory slot available,{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1033777201815191558|date=26 August 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/jS1An|archivedate=30 May 2020|quote=Yes, though skilling features will aim to avoid that by putting a new pet in your inventory ahead of whatever skilling resource you were about to be given.}} while the resource gathered will be dropped underneath the player if their inventory becomes full. However, this '''does not''' apply to Farming due to the complexity of the skill's code.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1162879828384722946|date=17 August 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.vn/feExs|archivedate=14 January 2021|quote=The herb would get the slot and the pet roll would not give you the pet. The devs who plugged in skill pets were able to prioritise the pets for Mining, Hunter, Fishing and Woodcutting, but the Farming code seems to have been nastier to handle that way.}} Players can still roll for pet [[drops]] even if they already own it. It does not affect their main drop, as pet drops are tertiary drops. When this happens, players will receive the message {{RSFont|You have a funny feeling like you would have been followed...|color=red}} The only exception to this is the [[abyssal orphan]] due to being obtained differently compared to other pets. If a player dies with a one-off pet following them (or if it is in their inventory and it is not one of the items protected on death) in a dangerous situation, the pet will be dropped and wander around the area for 30 seconds before despawning. Even if the player returns in time, the pet cannot be picked up. If the pet is not insured, players must re-obtain the pet as if they never had it. If insured, players can head to [[Probita]] and reclaim the pet for 1,000,000 coins. In order to insure a pet, the player must visit Probita and pay 500,000 coins. The player can still obtain the pet again from its respective drop source, and if the pet is re-obtained this way it will also be insured. If a player runs out of membership with a pet still following them, the pet is placed in their inventory. They will receive the message {{RSFont|Your pet is scared into your backpack.|color=red}} ==List of pets== ===Boss pets=== These pets usually resemble the [[boss]]es that drop them, or the bosses that they are associated with. {| class="wikitable lighttable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !colspan=2|Pet !Source !Drop rate |- |{{plinkt|Abyssal orphan}}||Using an [[unsired]] on the [[Abyssal Nexus|Font of Consumption]]||1/2,560 (per Abyssal Sire kill)
5/128 (per unsired) |- |{{plinkp|Baby mole}}{{plinkp|Baby mole-rat}}||[[Baby mole]]/mole-ratTo change into a baby mole-rat, a [[mole claw]] must be used on the baby mole.||Dropped by the [[Giant Mole]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkt|Callisto cub}}||Dropped by [[Callisto]]||1/2,000 |- |{{plinkt|Hellpuppy}}||Dropped by [[Cerberus]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkp|Ikkle hydra}}{{plinkp|Ikkle hydra|pic=Ikkle hydra (four heads)}}{{plinkp|Ikkle hydra|pic=Ikkle hydra (three heads)}}{{plinkp|Ikkle hydra|pic=Ikkle hydra (two heads)}}||[[Ikkle hydra]]||Dropped by [[Alchemical Hydra]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkp|Jal-nib-rek}}{{plinkp|Tzrek-zuk}}||[[Jal-nib-rek]]/Tzrek-zuk||Defeating [[TzKal-Zuk]] or exchanging an [[infernal cape]] to [[TzHaar-Ket-Keh]]|| 1/100 (per kill or gamble)
1/75 (per kill on Slayer task) |- |{{plinkp|Kalphite princess}}{{plinkp|Kalphite princess|pic=Kalphite princess (2nd form)}}||[[Kalphite princess]]||Dropped by [[Kalphite Queen]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkp|Lil' zik}}{{plinkp|Lil' maiden}}{{plinkp|Lil' bloat}}{{plinkp|Lil' nylo}}{{plinkp|Lil' sot}}{{plinkp|Lil' xarp}}||[[Lil' zik]]/maiden/bloat/nylo/sot/xarp[[Sanguine dust]] is required to metamorphose into all five variants.||[[Theatre of Blood]] reward||1/650 (per completion, with optimal performance) |- |{{plinkp|Little nightmare}}{{plinkp|Little parasite}}||[[Little nightmare]]/parasiteTo change into Little Parasite, a [[parasitic egg]] must be used on Little Nightmare.||Dropped by [[The Nightmare]]||1/800 to 1/4000 (From 1 to 5+ team size) |- |{{plinkt|Nexling}}||Dropped by [[Nex]]||1/500 |- |{{plinkp|Noon}}{{plinkp|Midnight}}||[[Noon]]/Midnight||Dropped by the [[Grotesque Guardians]]|| 1/3,000 |- |{{plinkp|Olmlet}}{{plinkp|Puppadile}}{{plinkp|Tektiny}}{{plinkp|Vanguard (pet)}}{{plinkp|Vasa minirio}}{{plinkp|Vespina}}||[[Olmlet]]/Puppadile/Tektiny/Vanguard/Vasa Minirio/Vespina[[Metamorphic dust]] is required to metamorphose into all seven variants.||[[Great Olm]] at the end of the [[Chambers of Xeric]]||1/53 (per broadcasted unique item) |- |{{plinkt|Pet chaos elemental}}||Dropped by the [[Chaos Elemental]] and [[Chaos Fanatic]]||1/300 (Elemental)
1/1,000 (Fanatic) |- |{{plinkt|Pet dagannoth prime}}||Dropped by [[Dagannoth Prime]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet dagannoth rex}}||Dropped by [[Dagannoth Rex]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet dagannoth supreme}}||Dropped by [[Dagannoth Supreme]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkp|Pet dark core}}{{plinkp|Pet corporeal critter}}||[[Pet dark core]]||Dropped by [[Corporeal Beast]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet general graardor}}||Dropped by [[General Graardor]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet k'ril tsutsaroth}}||Dropped by [[K'ril Tsutsaroth]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet kraken}}||Dropped by [[Kraken]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet kree'arra}}||Dropped by [[Kree'arra]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkp|Pet smoke devil}}{{plinkp|Pet smoke devil (normal)}}||[[Pet smoke devil]]||Dropped by the [[Thermonuclear smoke devil]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkp|Pet snakeling}}{{plinkp|Pet snakeling (magma)}}{{plinkp|Pet snakeling (tanzanite)}}||[[Pet snakeling]]||Dropped by [[Zulrah]]||1/4,000 |- |{{plinkt|Pet zilyana}}||Dropped by [[Commander Zilyana]]||1/5,000 |- |{{plinkt|Prince black dragon}}||Dropped by the [[King Black Dragon]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkt|Scorpia's offspring}}||Dropped by [[Scorpia]]||1/2,015.75 |- |{{plinkt|Skotos}}||Dropped by [[Skotizo]]||1/65 |- |{{plinkp|Sraracha}}{{plinkp|Sraracha (orange)}}{{plinkp|Sraracha (blue)}}||[[Sraracha]]An [[Orange egg sac|orange]] or [[blue egg sac]] is required to metamorphose into its respective variant.||Dropped by [[Sarachnis]]||1/3,000 |- |{{plinkp|Tzrek-jad}}{{plinkp|Jalrek-jad}}||[[Tzrek-jad]]/Jalrek-jadTo change into JalRek-Jad, all six of [[TzHaar-Ket-Rak's Challenges]] must be completed.||Defeating [[TzTok-Jad]] or exchanging a [[fire cape]] to [[TzHaar-Mej-Jal]]||1/200 (per kill or gamble)
1/100 (per kill on Slayer task) |- |{{plinkt|Venenatis spiderling}}||Dropped by [[Venenatis]]||1/2,000 |- |{{plinkp|Vet'ion jr.}}{{plinkp|Vet'ion jr.|pic=Vet'ion jr. (Reborn)}}||[[Vet'ion jr.]]||Dropped by [[Vet'ion]]||1/2,000 |- |{{plinkt|Vorki}}||Dropped by [[Vorkath]]||1/3,000 |} {{Reflist|group="b"}} ===Skilling pets=== These pets are obtained by training a specific [[Skills|skill]], with the chance of obtaining one being based on the player's level in the corresponding skill and the base chance of the activity being performed. For all [[drop rate]]s, use the formula: \text{DropRate} = \frac{1}{\text{BaseChance} - (\text{SkillLevel} * 25)}. Base chances are found in the individual page of each pet. Players with [[200 million experience]] in the corresponding skill will be fifteen times more likely in receiving the skilling pet.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Kieren|url=https://twitter.com/JagexKieren/status/784723957450702848|date=8 October 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/26iPj|archivedate=25 May 2020|quote=15x more likely.}} As the rates use the player's base level, [[temporary skill boost]]s such as the [[dragon pickaxe]]'s [[special attack]] or invisible boosts in areas such as the [[Woodcutting Guild]] do not affect the rate at which players can obtain these pets.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ed|url=https://twitter.com/JagexEd/status/877884145329897472|date=22 July 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/761oo|archivedate=30 May 2020|quote=It doesn't affect the rate but it will allow you to mine slightly faster than you'd be able to otherwise.}} {|class="wikitable lighttable" style="text-align:center;" |- !colspan=2|Pet !Source !Drop rate |- |{{plinkp|Baby chinchompa|pic=Baby chinchompa (red)}}

tempor}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||{{NA}}||9,825 |} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 6 October 2016 |update = The Hill Giant Boss |poll = |change = Talking to various NPCs in Tale of Two Cats/Icthlarin’s Little Helper quests while other pets are visible displays the correct dialogue. }} {{Subject changes |date = 28 April 2016 |update = Calling Pets & Deadman Death |poll = Old School Content Poll 41: Bank placeholders & Skillcapes |change = * Call pet button has been added to force your follower to appear next to you. * You will now receive a message if you would have obtained the pet on that kill, only if you already own the boss pet. }} {{Subject changes |date = 30 April 2015 |update = Mutagens, Mo & Much More |change = Pets now follow you up and down the Motherlode Mine's ladder. }} {{Subject changes |date = 9 April 2015 |update = Motherlode Expansion & More |poll = Old School Content Poll 31: Easter Holiday Event |change = The 'talk to' option is now the left-click option for boss pets rather than 'pick up'. Dialogue added for the chaos elemental pet, dark core pet and chompy bird pet. }} {{Subject changes |date = 21 August 2014 |update = In-Game Polls & Pet Insurance |poll = Old School feature poll - Content Poll 23 |change = [[Pet insurance]] is added to the game. }} {{Subject changes |date = 15 May 2014 |update = Coal & gem bags and Attack options |change = The options on other players' pets are no longer visible. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Trivia== *When a pet is in the inventory as an item, its name may be incorrectly capitalised; this is because all items in ''Old School RuneScape'' use ''ucfirst'' capitalisation, wherein the first letter of a string is capitalised, but the rest is not. For example, as an inventory item, ''[[TzTok-Jad]]'s'' pet is called ''[[Tzrek-jad]]'', but as a follower it's called ''TzRek-Jad''. *Players cannot go underwater if they have a pet following them or in their inventory, with the exception of [[pet kraken]] and [[pet chaos elemental]]. Furthermore, [[Tangleroot]] and [[Phoenix]] can be obtained underwater, but they cannot be taken back once the player leaves. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Pets}}
